intro: Cachrys hungarica, commonly known as the Hungarian thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, featuring upright stems and grayish-green, hairy leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, forming a dense, spherical cluster. Cachrys hungarica is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
